summary: So I've previously shared my theory on why Bakugou won't survive the series (I'll edit in a link or something), but that theory...
body:
Okay theory time

So I’ve previously shared my theory on why Bakugou won’t survive the series (I’ll edit in a link or something), but that theory is slowly evolving as BNHA continues.

The new color spread only continues to affirm my blossoming theory.

Obviously the swords that Bakugou and Deku are holding are the two halves of All Night’s sword from a previous color page. And I think we can all agree that it represents how both of them will carry on the legacy of All Might.

Well, what does carrying on the legacy of All Might really mean for their futures?

All Might carried on a form of the legacy of Nana Shimura and became the Symbol of Peace for the whole world. He became a hero who both wins and saves, and he did it all while smiling. By being the symbol of peace, he was the sole pillar of society. All Might was an Atlas to mankind. And being Atlas is not easy, especially because you do it alone.

And honestly, even if being the symbol of peace gave the world hope, the hope it gave was way too fragile if it shattered the second All Might reached his end.

So, I’m up for discussion if you disagree, but I believe Deku and Bakugou won’t share the title of Symbol of Peace. No, I think they will develop their own titles, and those who combine to be the new pillars of society. Like idk what term to use but something like the Symbol of Hope (Deku) and Symbol of Strength (Bakugou).

The exact term isn’t what matters, what matters is that Deku and Bakugou will represent two very very different things to society, but there will be no peace without either. They will rise to become number one hero together, but beyond that they will be the forces that truly save the world.

Because Atlas could’ve raised the world higher if he had help.

We still have a long way to go before we reach this point tho. Deku needs to continue developing through physical steps (he’s already for the “saving” mindset of a hero, now he needs to achieve the physicality of “winning”). Bakugou needs to continue developing through emotional steps (“saving” because he can already “win”.) I mean come on, they even have to develop in the complete opposite way in order to achieve their goals, how could they not end up working together.

But as they work on getting stronger through accepting their weaknesses, these two will become the greatest heros to ever exist, and they’ll do it reluctantly side by side.

I still think the series will end with one or more major character deaths (I still REALLY think Bakugou won’t survive the series), but it’s more than likely that Bakugou and Deku will carry on their own form of All Might’s legacy and form their own paths. Become new and different symbols for society.

But pillars nonetheless.

blog.title: cherry
blog.description: | multifandom account | mostly my hero academia | REQUESTS: opened! | 16 requests pending |

summary: how about deku not noticing his s/o is super jealous and upset with him ‘cause he is spending so much time with ochako? im so...
question: how about deku not noticing his s/o is super jealous and upset with him ‘cause he is spending so much time with ochako? im so needy for an angst with a fluffy end 🌤🍼💘🍓🎀🐻🍥🍜 thank you babie! *i wuv ur blog so muchie yaaaaaay*
answer:
omg i accidentally deleted this whole thing when i had one sentence left to write. hopefully it doesnt sound too cut off now. i love you all. -cherry

“Hey, Izuku. Where were you in the morning? You didn’t wait for…”, you walked up to the table you usually sat at at lunch. Your seat was the one inbetween Todoroki and your boyfriend of two weeks, Izuku Midoriya. But today someone had gone as far as to take your place.

Uraraka has been stealing all of your boyfriend’s attention for the past three days. You didn’t like it at all, whether it was on purpose or not. Midoriya hadn’t waited for you in front of the dorms to walk to school together this morning. Nor did he talk to you in class, no, he totally wiped you off his screen.

In anger and frustration, you slammed your lunch tray on the table, resulting in a loud, startling noise.

“Oh, hey (y/n)! Where have you been all day?”, Izuku finally noticed you, his gaze fixating on you instead of the brunette next to him.

Before you could answer, he was gone again, yanked away by the same girl that had been troubling you for some time now,

“Deku, I have to tell you something real quick.”

And with that they were gone.

As you slumped your body onto the chair, arms and head on the table, Todoroki spoke up,

“He’s failing at being a good boyfriend, I see.”

“Do not worry, (l/n)! I’m sure everything will work out just fine!”, Iida rubbed his hand on your back from the chair to the left of you.

“Maybe you should text him if you can’t catch him to talk to in person.”, the dual haired boy suggested, continuing to slurp his cold soba right after.

“I’ve tried, but he won’t respond.”, you threw your head back and leaned against the back of the chair, sighing. You needed some time alone, as you felt the tears welling up in your eyes, just like they had been every night now, so you stood up with quiet words before leaving,

“Please excuse me.”

“(l/n)…”, your friends at the table whispered after you were gone.

You sprinted towards the exit that Midoriya and Uraraka took and you immediately regretted that decision. When you walked out of the lunch area, you saw them hugging tightly. Ochako was nuzzling into Izuku’s uniform as his hands rubbed her back in comfort, a small smile painted on his face, his eyes closed.

You had to walk past them to get outside and so you did swiftly.

“It’s over, isn’t it?”, you mumbled when passing the embracing teens.

Arriving outside, you feared having a breakdown, so you did breathing excercises in order to calm you down. Sadly that plan backfired, making your eyes overflow with tears. Your legs couldn’t hold you much longer, so they gave in, leaving you in a sitting position against a wall.

“(y/n)? Did someone hurt you?”, a certain boy asked innocently, only to anger you to an even bigger extent. You didn’t even need to look up at him to know who it was. It seemed like he must’ve heard you pass by moments ago for him to even come here.

“Midoriya, if you love Uraraka, why would you start dating me? What was the point of hurting me?”, you cried bitterly, still on the floor.

At the sound of his last name coming out of your mouth, Izuku cringed, before he kneeled down in front of you.

“Please let me explain, ok?”

“No, you don’t have to. I know it’s—”, the green haired boy took the chance of you lifting your head to do something he’d never done with anyone, not even you. He grabbed your face and pressed his warm lips against yours shakily.

Much to your dismay, he pulled away rather quickly, panting ever so slightly.

“Please, I still love you! Uraraka just tried to teach me how to k-kiss these past three days! And I couldn’t face you in that time, without feeling embarrassed…I just wanted to make it perfect!”, Midoriya backed up and flailed his arms around.

“Of course I didn’t kiss her, but I kissed my…hand…But she gave instructions since she knows this stuff!”

“Izuku, why did she hug you though?”, you stopped his rambling.

“Ah! Well…”, he rubbed the back of his neck, before continuing,

“I wanted to thank her and thought a hug might be nice, I’m sorry. I’m really sorry for everything.”

You were extremely glad that everything had turned out just fine, so, still feeling a little emotional, you jumped into your boyfriend’s arms, unable to stop sniffling.

“You shouldn’t have made such a big deal out of that, you know?”, you mumbled into the embrace.

“I won’t do stupid stuff like that again, I promise.”, Izuku softly whispered.

Right after, the bell rang, signaling you that lunch was over and you had to return to class.

“Let’s go before we’re late!”, you two intertwined hands and started running to your class.

Needless to say, after school, he took you to his dorm room to shower you with affection, apologizing multiple times until you had to shut him up.

“It’s over, isn’t it?”, you mumbled when passing the embracing teens.

Arriving outside, you feared having a breakdown, so you did breathing excercises in order to calm you down. Sadly that plan backfired, making your eyes overflow with tears. Your legs couldn’t hold you much longer, so they gave in, leaving you in a sitting position against a wall.

“(y/n)? Did someone hurt you?”, a certain boy asked innocently, only to anger you to an even bigger extent. You didn’t even need to look up at him to know who it was. It seemed like he must’ve heard you pass by moments ago for him to even come here.

“Midoriya, if you love Uraraka, why would you start dating me? What was the point of hurting me?”, you cried bitterly, still on the floor.

At the sound of his last name coming out of your mouth, Izuku cringed, before he kneeled down in front of you.

“Please let me explain, ok?”

“No, you don’t have to. I know it’s—”, the green haired boy took the chance of you lifting your head to do something he’d never done with anyone, not even you. He grabbed your face and pressed his warm lips against yours shakily.

Much to your dismay, he pulled away rather quickly, panting ever so slightly.

“Please, I still love you! Uraraka just tried to teach me how to k-kiss these past three days! And I couldn’t face you in that time, without feeling embarrassed…I just wanted to make it perfect!”, Midoriya backed up and flailed his arms around.

“Of course I didn’t kiss her, but I kissed my…hand…But she gave instructions since she knows this stuff!”

“Izuku, why did she hug you though?”, you stopped his rambling.

“Ah! Well…”, he rubbed the back of his neck, before continuing,

“I wanted to thank her and thought a hug might be nice, I’m sorry. I’m really sorry for everything.”

You were extremely glad that everything had turned out just fine, so, still feeling a little emotional, you jumped into your boyfriend’s arms, unable to stop sniffling.

“You shouldn’t have made such a big deal out of that, you know?”, you mumbled into the embrace.

“I won’t do stupid stuff like that again, I promise.”, Izuku softly whispered.

Right after, the bell rang, signaling you that lunch was over and you had to return to class.

“Let’s go before we’re late!”, you two intertwined hands and started running to your class.

Needless to say, after school, he took you to his dorm room to shower you with affection, apologizing multiple times until you had to shut him up.
trail.content:
omg i accidentally deleted this whole thing when i had one sentence left to write. hopefully it doesnt sound too cut off now. i love you all. -cherry

“Hey, Izuku. Where were you in the morning? You didn’t wait for…”, you walked up to the table you usually sat at at lunch. Your seat was the one inbetween Todoroki and your boyfriend of two weeks, Izuku Midoriya. But today someone had gone as far as to take your place.

Uraraka has been stealing all of your boyfriend’s attention for the past three days. You didn’t like it at all, whether it was on purpose or not. Midoriya hadn’t waited for you in front of the dorms to walk to school together this morning. Nor did he talk to you in class, no, he totally wiped you off his screen.

In anger and frustration, you slammed your lunch tray on the table, resulting in a loud, startling noise.

“Oh, hey (y/n)! Where have you been all day?”, Izuku finally noticed you, his gaze fixating on you instead of the brunette next to him.

Before you could answer, he was gone again, yanked away by the same girl that had been troubling you for some time now,

“Deku, I have to tell you something real quick.”

And with that they were gone.

As you slumped your body onto the chair, arms and head on the table, Todoroki spoke up,

“He’s failing at being a good boyfriend, I see.”

“Do not worry, (l/n)! I’m sure everything will work out just fine!”, Iida rubbed his hand on your back from the chair to the left of you.

“Maybe you should text him if you can’t catch him to talk to in person.”, the dual haired boy suggested, continuing to slurp his cold soba right after.

“I’ve tried, but he won’t respond.”, you threw your head back and leaned against the back of the chair, sighing. You needed some time alone, as you felt the tears welling up in your eyes, just like they had been every night now, so you stood up with quiet words before leaving,

“Please excuse me.”

“(l/n)…”, your friends at the table whispered after you were gone.

You sprinted towards the exit that Midoriya and Uraraka took and you immediately regretted that decision. When you walked out of the lunch area, you saw them hugging tightly. Ochako was nuzzling into Izuku’s uniform as his hands rubbed her back in comfort, a small smile painted on his face, his eyes closed.

You had to walk past them to get outside and so you did swiftly.

“It’s over, isn’t it?”, you mumbled when passing the embracing teens.

Arriving outside, you feared having a breakdown, so you did breathing excercises in order to calm you down. Sadly that plan backfired, making your eyes overflow with tears. Your legs couldn’t hold you much longer, so they gave in, leaving you in a sitting position against a wall.

“(y/n)? Did someone hurt you?”, a certain boy asked innocently, only to anger you to an even bigger extent. You didn’t even need to look up at him to know who it was. It seemed like he must’ve heard you pass by moments ago for him to even come here.

“Midoriya, if you love Uraraka, why would you start dating me? What was the point of hurting me?”, you cried bitterly, still on the floor.

At the sound of his last name coming out of your mouth, Izuku cringed, before he kneeled down in front of you.

“Please let me explain, ok?”

“No, you don’t have to. I know it’s—”, the green haired boy took the chance of you lifting your head to do something he’d never done with anyone, not even you. He grabbed your face and pressed his warm lips against yours shakily.

Much to your dismay, he pulled away rather quickly, panting ever so slightly.

“Please, I still love you! Uraraka just tried to teach me how to k-kiss these past three days! And I couldn’t face you in that time, without feeling embarrassed…I just wanted to make it perfect!”, Midoriya backed up and flailed his arms around.

“Of course I didn’t kiss her, but I kissed my…hand…But she gave instructions since she knows this stuff!”

“Izuku, why did she hug you though?”, you stopped his rambling.

“Ah! Well…”, he rubbed the back of his neck, before continuing,

“I wanted to thank her and thought a hug might be nice, I’m sorry. I’m really sorry for everything.”

You were extremely glad that everything had turned out just fine, so, still feeling a little emotional, you jumped into your boyfriend’s arms, unable to stop sniffling.

“You shouldn’t have made such a big deal out of that, you know?”, you mumbled into the embrace.

“I won’t do stupid stuff like that again, I promise.”, Izuku softly whispered.

Right after, the bell rang, signaling you that lunch was over and you had to return to class.

“Let’s go before we’re late!”, you two intertwined hands and started running to your class.

Needless to say, after school, he took you to his dorm room to shower you with affection, apologizing multiple times until you had to shut him up.
